Described Disease.MONDO: N.D. (Note: MONDO term number retrieval requires access to MONDO database, here we assume it's not available)

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Homology Modeling of the Kinase Domain of PINK1

Material used.Description: Sequence analysis indicated that amino acids 235 - 554 of human PINK1 were similar to the family of eukaryotic serine/threonine protein kinases. A model of this domain was constructed from a set of homologous kinase domain crystal structures by using techniques implemented in the WHATIF suite of programs.

Readout description.Result Description: The model predicts that the putative catalytic aspartate, D362, and the metal - binding site (D384) are relatively close to each other and are likely to form an active site. The G309 and L347 sites where recessive point mutations have been found are not predicted to be within the active site but in areas that may be important for protein folding. G309 is predicted to be in a loop near the PSTAIRE helix and the ATP binding site. A G309D substitution is unlikely to grossly destabilize the fold but could interfere electrostatically with ATP binding or hydrolysis. L347 is predicted to be in the middle of a PSTAIRE helix, a helical segment that forms part of the cyclin binding surface in the cyclin - dependent protein kinases.

Material used.Material Name: cDNA encoding the full - length of human PINK1 (residues 1 - 581) cloned into the Gateway entry clone
Material used.Description: A cDNA encoding the full - length of human PINK1 (residues 1 - 581) cloned into the Gateway entry clone was purchased from Genecopoeia. Full - length PINK1 was transferred into destination vectors by using Gateway recombination technology. Also, various vectors like pcDNA - DEST47, pcDNA - DEST53, pCM - VTnT were used to fuse tags to PINK1, and site - directed mutagenesis was performed to introduce mutations.

Readout description.Result Description: Successfully constructed plasmids with wild - type and mutant PINK1 (L347P, G309D, K219A, D362A, D384A, K219A/D362A/D384A) for further experiments.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Protein Purification and in Vitro Kinase Assays

Material used.Description: The kinase domain of wild - type or mutant human PINK1 cDNAs was amplified, ligated into pGEX - 5X - 1 for fusion with the N terminus of GST. PINK1 fusion proteins were expressed in Escherichia coli BL21 (DE3). Cells were grown, induced with isopropyl Î² - D - thiogalactopyranoside, harvested, lysed, and the supernatant was incubated with Glutathione Sepharose 4B beads to purify the fusion proteins.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (decreased activity compared to wild - type)
Readout description.Result Description: G309D had somewhat decreased activity (60.5% of wild type; P = 0.01) in the autophosphorylation assay.

Readout description.Conclusion: Abnormal (drastically decreased activity compared to wild - type)
Readout description.Result Description: L347P had drastically decreased activity (<10% of wild type) in the autophosphorylation assay, and recombinant L347P GST - PINK1 fusions were unstable.

Biological replicates.Description: n = 3 independent experiments for kinase activity quantification

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Fisher's PLSD post hoc test was used to analyze differences in autophosphorylation activity between different recombinant proteins

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on the data, normal activity is considered as the activity of wild - type PINK1 in the autophosphorylation assay, but no specific numerical threshold is given in the text)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on the data, abnormal activity is considered as activity significantly different from wild - type PINK1 in the autophosphorylation assay, but no specific numerical threshold is given in the text)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (In vitro kinase assays are common for studying kinase - related functions in the context of disease - associated genes)

Material used.Description: Proteins resolved on SDS/PAGE from transfected COS7 or M17 cells were blotted. Antibodies used were monoclonal anti - GFP, anti - myc, and anti - Î² - actin.

Readout description.Result Description: The amount of transfected L347P protein was drastically decreased compared to wild - type or other constructs, while mRNA levels were not significantly different. No effect was noted for G309D constructs.

Biological replicates.Description: All data represent the means Â± SEM from at least triplicate determinations

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on the data, normal protein levels are considered as the levels of wild - type PINK1, but no specific numerical threshold is given in the text)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on the data, abnormal protein levels are considered as levels significantly different from wild - type PINK1, but no specific numerical threshold is given in the text)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Immunoblotting is a common method for studying protein expression levels in the context of disease - related genes)

Material used.Material Name: GFP - tagged PINK1 in Cos - 7 cells
Material used.Description: Cos - 7 cells were transiently transfected with GFP - tagged PINK1. Cells were starved, labeled with [35S]Met/[35S]Cys, chased in complete medium, lysed, and transfected proteins were immunoprecipitated and analyzed by SDS/PAGE.

Readout description.Result Description: The half - life of wild - type N - terminal GFP - tagged PINK1 was â2 h, whereas the L347P mutation had a half - life of 0.25 h.

Biological replicates.Description: Similar estimates of stability were obtained in duplicate experiments

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on the data, normal half - life is considered as the half - life of wild - type PINK1, but no specific numerical threshold is given in the text)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on the data, abnormal half - life is considered as half - life significantly different from wild - type PINK1, but no specific numerical threshold is given in the text)

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Pulse - Chase Labeling is a common method for studying protein turnover in the context of disease - related genes)

Material used.Description: Total RNA was isolated from cells 48 h after transfection, treated with DNase I, and reverse transcribed. cDNA templates were used for real - time quantitative PCR with specific primers for PINK1 and Î² - actin.

Readout description.Conclusion: Normal (no significant difference in mRNA levels)
Readout description.Result Description: There were no statistically significant differences in mRNA levels between L347P and wild - type or other constructs (P = 0.23 by ANOVA; n = 3)
